title: Welcome Home Rituals
summary: Set a predictable rhythm so your puppy quickly learns that people, crates, and hands bring comfort.

lessons.title: Name-Game Check Ins
lessons.objective: Teach your puppy that their name predicts eye contact and rewards.
steps: Say the puppy's name once while they are near you and quietly wait.
Mark any head turn or eye contact with a cheerful yes and feed.
Toss a reset treat a few feet away, then repeat from different angles.
End after five solid reps to keep the game snappy.
supportGuidelines: Coach guardians to pause after saying the name—no repeating.
Celebrate even tiny flicks of the ear to build momentum.
Suggest they log the best times of day for sharp responses.
lessons.safetyNotes: Avoid practicing when the puppy is sound asleep or over-hungry.

lessons.title: Crate = Cozy Den
lessons.objective: Create a positive first impression of alone-time space.
steps: Prop the crate door open and scatter three treats just inside.
Feed the puppy for choosing to step in, then let them walk back out freely.
Offer a stuffed chew in the back corner and close the door for 10 seconds once they settle.
Open, release with a calm cue, and repeat with slightly longer door time.
supportGuidelines: Remind humans to breathe slowly and keep voices low near the crate.
Encourage adding a worn T-shirt if the puppy is nervous.
Track the longest relaxed duration each day to show progress.
lessons.safetyNotes: Never force a puppy inside—regress and rebuild if they freeze or vocalize.

lessons.title: Potty Spot Routine
lessons.objective: Create a predictable bathroom schedule and location.
steps: Clip on leash and walk directly to the chosen potty zone without detours.
Stand still, repeat the potty cue once, and give the puppy a full minute.
Mark success with a soft yes and feed two treats right at the spot.
Add a quick sniff walk only after the puppy finishes to reinforce the sequence.
supportGuidelines: Have families note wake-up, meal, and play times to predict windows.
Coach them to carry the puppy out if accidents spike indoors.
Share the 3-day clean streak goal before expanding freedom.
lessons.safetyNotes: Skip harsh cleaners outdoors; use enzyme cleaner inside to prevent re-soiling.

lessons.title: Gentle Mouth Swaps
lessons.objective: Redirect nippy play onto legal toys.
steps: Offer a tug toy, wiggle low to the ground, and let the puppy latch on.
Say trade, present the second toy, and mark when they release the first.
Feed a treat while you hold the chew so teeth learn to land softly.
If biting escalates, calmly stand up, fold arms, and pause the game for 20 seconds.
supportGuidelines: Coach guardians to log what textures calm their puppy fastest.
Model neutral faces—no squealing or sudden jerks.
Encourage swapping toys after two reps to prevent resource guarding.
lessons.safetyNotes: Stop immediately if teeth graze faces or clothing strings to avoid accidental tearing.

lessons.title: Handling Happy Hour
lessons.objective: Pair gentle touch with rewards for future vet care.
steps: Stroke down the puppy's back once, then feed.
Touch an ear flap for one second, feed, and release.
Lift each paw briefly, tapping nails with a finger before rewarding.
Finish with a short brushstroke along the shoulders and jackpot calm breathing.
supportGuidelines: Remind families to stop before the puppy wriggles away.
Suggest layering this on the couch or mat they relax on.
Encourage recording which body parts still feel tricky for coaching later.
lessons.safetyNotes: Avoid tugging fur or restraining the puppy; let them step away between reps.
